intro: Ovieda mitis, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silvery, hairy leaves that reflect sunlight. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. Ovieda mitis thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy species in Mediterranean climates. Its ornamental value lies in its striking foliage and delicate floral display.
